member.name: T:Wisej.Web.MaskedTextBox
member.summary: Uses a mask to distinguish between proper and improper user input.

remarks.para: The MaskedTextBox class is an enhanced control that supports a declarative syntax for accepting or rejecting user input. Using the property, you can enforce the following input types without writing any custom validation logic in your application:

item.term: The type of input expected at a given position in the mask; for example, a digit, or an alphabetic or alphanumeric character.
Mask literals, or characters that should appear directly in the MaskedTextBox; for example, the hyphens(-) in a phone number, or the currency symbol in a price.
Special processing for input characters; for example, to convert alphabetic characters to uppercase.
Special processing for input characters; for example, to convert alphabetic characters to uppercase.

remarks.para: When a control is displayed at run time, it represents the mask as a series of prompt characters and optional literal characters. Each editable mask position, representing a required or optional input, is shown with a single prompt character. For example, the number sign (#) is often used as a placeholder for a numeric character input. You can use the property to specify a custom prompt character. The property determines if the user sees the prompt characters when the control loses input focus

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.MaskedTextBox.Mask
member.summary: Returns or sets the input mask.
member.returns: The current mask . The default value is the empty string which allows any input.

remarks.para: The is a string that defines the masking characters and the literals to display and process during user input and when reading the property.

Server side masking is processed by an instance of the class exposed by the property. On the client side, the mask processing is performed by the "wisej.utils.MaskProvider.js" class while the user edits the input field.

entry.para: Masking Character
Description
Digit, required. This element will accept any single digit between 0 and 9.
Digit or space, optional.
Digit or space, optional. If this position is blank in the mask, it will be rendered as a space in the Text property. Plus (+) and minus (-) signs are allowed.
L
Letter, required. Restricts input to the ASCII letters a-z and A-Z. This mask element is equivalent to [a-zA-Z] in regular expressions.
Letter, optional. Restricts input to the ASCII letters a-z and A-Z. This mask element is equivalent to [a-zA-Z]? in regular expressions.
Character, required. This element behaves like the "L" element.
C
Character, optional. Any non-control character. This element behaves like the "?" element.
A
Alphanumeric, required. The only characters it will accept are the ASCII letters a-z and A-Z. This mask element behaves like the "a" element.
a
Alphanumeric, optional. The only characters it will accept are the ASCII letters a-z and A-Z. This mask element behaves like the "A" element.
Decimal placeholder. The actual display character used will be the decimal symbol appropriate to the format provider, as determined by the control's FormatProvider property.
Thousands placeholder. The actual display character used will be the thousands placeholder appropriate to the format provider, as determined by the control's FormatProvider property.
Time separator. The actual display character used will be the time symbol appropriate to the format provider, as determined by the control's FormatProvider property.
Date separator. The actual display character used will be the date symbol appropriate to the format provider, as determined by the control's FormatProvider property.
Currency symbol. The actual character displayed will be the currency symbol appropriate to the format provider, as determined by the control's FormatProvider property.
Shift down. Converts all characters that follow to lowercase.
Shift up. Converts all characters that follow to uppercase.
Disable a previous shift up or shift down.
Escape. Escapes a mask character, turning it into a literal. "\\" is the escape sequence for a backslash.
Others
Literals. All non-mask elements will appear as themselves within MaskedTextBox. Literals always occupy a static position in the mask at run time, and cannot be moved or deleted by the user.

remarks.para: If you change the when the control already contains a value, it will apply the new mask to the existing text.

The decimal (.), thousand (,), time (:), date (/), and currency ($) symbols default to displaying those symbols as defined by the application's culture. You can force a specific to display symbols for another culture by using the property. Otherwise you can set the application-wide culture by setting the property.

member.exception: The index is less than zero; or the index is greater than or equal to .

remarks.para: Bounding rectangles for the tab buttons are received from the client and are updated asynchronously. If the application adds a tab page, or changes any property that causes the tab button to be resized (orientation, sizing, text, alignment, etc.) it cannot immediately after retrieve the new bounds.
When the tab rectangles are updated, the will fire the event to inform the application that the bounding rectangles have been updated.
In alternative, you can use the and overloads to query the client and receive the new bounding rectangle for the request tab page.
Bounding rectangles are always empty until the has been rendered on the client.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.TextBox.AcceptsReturn
member.summary: Returns or sets whether pressing ENTER in a multiline control creates a new line of text in the control or activates the default button for the form.
member.returns: true if the ENTER key creates a new line of text when is true; false if the ENTER key activates the default button for the form. The default is false.

remarks.para: If the value of is false, the user must press CTRL+ENTER to create a new line.
If there is no default button for the parent or , the ENTER key will always create a new line, regardless of the value of this property.

member.summary: Returns or sets the character used to mask characters of a password in a single-line control.
member.remarks: This property only enables/disables the password mode for the textbox. It doesn't change the password masking character used by the browser.
member.returns: The character used to mask characters entered in a single-line control. Set the value of this property to 0 (character value) if you do not want the control to mask characters as they are typed. Equals 0 (character value) by default.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.TextBoxBase.AcceptsTab
member.summary: Returns or sets whether pressing the TAB key in a multiline text box control types a TAB character in the control instead of moving the focus to the next control in the tab order.
member.returns: true if users can enter tabs in a multiline text box using the TAB key; false if pressing the TAB key moves the focus. The default is false.

remarks.para: The property must be true to get a TAB character in the control.
If the property is set to true, the user can press SHIFT+TAB to move the focus to the next control in the tab order.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewMaskedTextBoxCell.Mask
member.summary: Returns or sets the input mask.
member.returns: The current mask . The default value is the empty string which allows any input.

remarks.para: The is a string that defines the masking characters and the literals to display and process during user input and when reading the property.

Server side masking is processed by an instance of the class exposed by the property. On the client side, the mask processing is performed by the "wisej.utils.MaskProvider.js" class while the user edits the input field.

entry.para: Masking Character
Description
Digit, required. This element will accept any single digit between 0 and 9.
Digit or space, optional.
Digit or space, optional. If this position is blank in the mask, it will be rendered as a space in the Text property. Plus (+) and minus (-) signs are allowed.
L
Letter, required. Restricts input to the ASCII letters a-z and A-Z. This mask element is equivalent to [a-zA-Z] in regular expressions.
Letter, optional. Restricts input to the ASCII letters a-z and A-Z. This mask element is equivalent to [a-zA-Z]? in regular expressions.
Character, required. This element behaves like the "L" element.
C
Character, optional. Any non-control character. This element behaves like the "?" element.
A
Alphanumeric, required. The only characters it will accept are the ASCII letters a-z and A-Z. This mask element behaves like the "a" element.
a
Alphanumeric, optional. The only characters it will accept are the ASCII letters a-z and A-Z. This mask element behaves like the "A" element.
Decimal placeholder. The actual display character used will be the decimal symbol appropriate to the format provider, as determined by the control's FormatProvider property.
Thousands placeholder. The actual display character used will be the thousands placeholder appropriate to the format provider, as determined by the control's FormatProvider property.
Time separator. The actual display character used will be the time symbol appropriate to the format provider, as determined by the control's FormatProvider property.
Date separator. The actual display character used will be the date symbol appropriate to the format provider, as determined by the control's FormatProvider property.
Currency symbol. The actual character displayed will be the currency symbol appropriate to the format provider, as determined by the control's FormatProvider property.
Shift down. Converts all characters that follow to lowercase.
Shift up. Converts all characters that follow to uppercase.
Disable a previous shift up or shift down.
Escape. Escapes a mask character, turning it into a literal. "\\" is the escape sequence for a backslash.
Others
Literals. All non-mask elements will appear as themselves within MaskedTextBox. Literals always occupy a static position in the mask at run time, and cannot be moved or deleted by the user.

remarks.para: If you change the when the control already contains a value, it will apply the new mask to the existing text.

The decimal (.), thousand (,), time (:), date (/), and currency ($) symbols default to displaying those symbols as defined by the application's culture. You can force a specific them to display symbols for another culture by using the property. Otherwise you can set the application-wide culture by setting the property.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewMaskedTextBoxCell.PromptChar
member.summary: Returns or sets the character used to represent the absence of user input in .
member.returns: The character used to prompt the user for input. The default is an underscore (_).
member.exception: The character specified when setting this property is not a valid prompt character, as determined by the method of the class.
The prompt character specified is the same as the current password character, . The two are required to be different.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewMaskedTextBoxCell.TextMaskFormat
member.summary: Returns or sets a value that determines whether literals and prompt characters are included in the formatted string.
member.returns: One of the values. The default is .

member.summary: Returns or sets the maximum number of characters that can be entered into the text box.
member.returns: The maximum number of characters that can be entered into the text box; the default value is 0 (unlimited).
member.exception: The value is less than 0.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.DataGridView.AllowUserToAddRows
member.summary: Returns or sets whether the user can add new rows.
member.returns: true if a new row is automatically shown to the user; otherwise false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.DataGridView.AllowSortingDataSource
member.summary: Returns or sets whether the can automatically sort rows in the when the data is in an object.
member.returns: true if a data source can be sorted automatically. The default is true.

remarks.para: When the is data-bound, sorting is delegated to the when it supports sorting (see ). Otherwise, if the data is in an object and is true, Wisej swaps the rows in the data source.

This behavior is different than WinForms, where sorting of the data source is always delegated to the data source and is otherwise ignored. Setting to false reverts to the same behavior as in WinForms.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.DataGridView.AllowUserToDeleteRows
member.summary: Returns or sets whether the user is allowed to delete rows from the .
member.returns: true if the user can delete rows; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.DataGridView.AllowUserToOrderColumns

member.returns: true if the user can change the column order; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.DataGridView.AllowUserToResizeColumns
member.summary: Returns or sets whether users can resize columns.
member.returns: true if users can resize columns; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.DataGridView.AllowUserToResizeRows
member.summary: Returns or sets whether users can resize rows.
member.returns: true if all the rows are resizable; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewRow.ParentRow
member.summary: Returns or sets the parent row.

remarks.para: When a row has a parent row, it is displayed as child row in a tree-like structure. To enumerate all the child rows use the property.
When changing the parent row, Wisej tries to enforce the correct sequence of rows in the structure like this:

item.description: The preceding rows with null parent will also become child rows using the same parent.
If the parent being assigned is not a direct ancestor, it will throw an exception.
When setting the parent to null, all the following rows that are not descendants will also lose their parent.
When adding or inserting a row, the new row will receive the same parent as the row at the location it is being inserted at.

member.exception: When the parent is not a valid ancestor and it would cause break in the tree sequence.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewRow.IsParent

member.remarks: Setting this property to true when the row doesn't have any children, will cause the row to expand anyway and request the child rows from the server.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewRow.IsExpanded

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode
member.summary: Defines values for specifying how the width of a column is adjusted.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode.NotSet
member.summary: The sizing behavior of the column is inherited from the property.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode.None
member.summary: The column width does not automatically adjust.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode.ColumnHeader
member.summary: The column width adjusts to fit the contents of the column header cell.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode.AllCellsExceptHeader
member.summary: The column width adjusts to fit the contents of all cells in the column, excluding the header cell. Since the DataGridView uses virtual scrolling, the width of the column may grow as new cells are downloaded and become visible.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode.AllCells
member.summary: The column width adjusts to fit the contents of all cells in the column, including the header cell. Since the DataGridView uses virtual scrolling, the width of the column may grow as new cells are downloaded and become visible.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode.DisplayedCellsExceptHeader
member.summary: The column width adjusts to fit the contents of all cells in the column that are in rows currently displayed, excluding the header cell.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode.DisplayedCells
member.summary: The column width adjusts to fit the contents of all cells in the column that are in rows currently displayed, including the header cell.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode.Fill
member.summary:
The column width adjusts so that the widths of all columns exactly fills the display area of the control, requiring horizontal scrolling only to keep column widths above the property values.
Relative column widths are determined by the relative property values.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewAutoSizeColumnMode.DoubleClick
member.summary: Adjusts the width of the column to fit the when the user double clicks the separator line to the right of the column.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewSelectionMode
member.summary: Describes how cells of a DataGridView control can be selected.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewSelectionMode.CellSelect
member.summary: One or more individual cells can be selected.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewSelectionMode.FullRowSelect
member.summary: The entire row will be selected by clicking its row's header or a cell contained in that row.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewSelectionMode.FullColumnSelect
member.summary: The entire column will be selected by clicking the column's header or a cell contained in that column.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewSelectionMode.RowHeaderSelect
member.summary: The row will be selected by clicking in the row's header cell. An individual cell can be selected by clicking that cell.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewSelectionMode.ColumnHeaderSelect
member.summary: The column will be selected by clicking in the column's header cell. An individual cell can be selected by clicking that cell.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewSelectionMode.RowColumnHeaderSelect
member.summary: The column or the row will be selected by clicking on the header cell. An individual cell can be selected by clicking that cell.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewSelectionMode.NoSelection
member.summary: Selection is disabled.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewTriState
member.summary: Defines values for specifying one of three possible states.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewTriState.NotSet
member.summary: The property is not set.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewTriState.True
member.summary: The property's state is true.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.DataGridViewTriState.False
member.summary: The property's state is false.

The text to display in the message box. Newlines (CRLF) are converted to
when the text doesn't contain any html.
One of the values that specifies which icon to display in the message box.
Shows or hides the close button. If not set it's managed automatically.
One of the values that specifies where on the screen to display the alert box.
A value in milliseconds that determines the delay after which the alert box disappears automatically. The default is 5000 (5 seconds). If set to 0 the box stays open.
Optional async handler for the close event; called when the Alert Box is closed either automatically or by the user.
Shows a progress bar to display the time remaining until the alert box is automatically closed. If left null, it's managed by the theme.
Allows the message text to include HTML code.

member.name: M:Wisej.Web.Canvas.Transform(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Replaces the current transformation matrix.
member.remarks:
The transformation will only affect drawings made after the transform() method is called.
The transform() method behaves relatively to other transformations made by rotate(), scale(), translate(), or transform(). Example: If you already have set your drawing to scale by two, and the transform() method scales your drawings by two, your drawings will now scale by four.
member.param: Scales the drawing horizontally.
Skew the drawing horizontally.
Skew the drawing vertically.
Scales the drawing vertically.
Moves the drawing horizontally
Moves the drawing vertically.

member.name: M:Wisej.Web.Canvas.SetTransform(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Resets the current transform to the identity matrix, and then runs transform() with the same arguments.
member.remarks:
The transformation will only affect drawings made after the transform() method is called.
The transform() method behaves relatively to other transformations made by rotate(), scale(), translate(), or transform(). Example: If you already have set your drawing to scale by two, and the transform() method scales your drawings by two, your drawings will now scale by four.
member.param: Scales the drawing horizontally.
Skew the drawing horizontally.
Skew the drawing vertically.
Scales the drawing vertically.
Moves the drawing horizontally
Moves the drawing vertically.

member.name: M:Wisej.Web.Canvas.Clip

member.remarks: Once a region is clipped, all future drawing will be limited to the clipped region (no access to other regions on the canvas). You can however save the current canvas region using the save() method before using the clip() method, and restore it (with the restore() method) any time in the future.

member.name: M:Wisej.Web.Canvas.QuadraticCurveTo(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a point to the current path by using the specified control points that represent a quadratic Bézier curve.
member.remarks: A quadratic Bézier curve requires two points. The first point is a control point that is used in the quadratic Bézier calculation and the second point is the ending point for the curve. The starting point for the curve is the last point in the current path. If a path does not exist, use the beginPath() and moveTo() methods to define a starting point.
member.param: The x-coordinate of the Bézier control point.
The y-coordinate of the Bézier control point.
The x-coordinate of the ending point.
The y-coordinate of the ending point.

member.name: M:Wisej.Web.Canvas.BezierCurveTo(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a point to the current path by using the specified control points that represent a cubic Bézier curve.
member.remarks: A cubic bezier curve requires three points. The first two points are control points that are used in the cubic Bézier calculation and the last point is the ending point for the curve. The starting point for the curve is the last point in the current path. If a path does not exist, use the beginPath() and moveTo() methods to define a starting point.
member.param: The x-coordinate of the first Bézier control point.
The y-coordinate of the first Bézier control point.
The x-coordinate of the second Bézier control point.
The y-coordinate of the second Bézier control point.
The x-coordinate of the ending point.
The y-coordinate of the ending point.

member.name: M:Wisej.Web.Canvas.ClosePath
member.summary: Creates a path from the current point back to the starting point.

member.summary: Saves the state of the current context.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.CanvasCompositeOperation
member.summary: Determines how a source (new) image are drawn onto a destination (existing) image.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.CanvasCompositeOperation.SourceOver
member.summary: Default. Displays the source image over the destination image.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.CanvasCompositeOperation.SourceAtop
member.summary: Displays the source image on top of the destination image. The part of the source image that is outside the destination image is not shown.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.CanvasCompositeOperation.SourceIn
member.summary: Displays the source image in to the destination image. Only the part of the source image that is INSIDE the destination image is shown, and the destination image is transparent.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.CanvasCompositeOperation.SourceOut
member.summary: Displays the source image out of the destination image. Only the part of the source image that is OUTSIDE the destination image is shown, and the destination image is transparent.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.CanvasCompositeOperation.DestinationOver
member.summary: Displays the destination image over the source image.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.CanvasCompositeOperation.DestinationAtop
member.summary: Displays the destination image on top of the source image. The part of the destination image that is outside the source image is not shown.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.CanvasCompositeOperation.DestinationIn
member.summary: Displays the destination image in to the source image. Only the part of the destination image that is INSIDE the source image is shown, and the source image is transparent.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.CanvasCompositeOperation.DestinationOut
member.summary: Displays the destination image out of the source image. Only the part of the destination image that is OUTSIDE the source image is shown, and the source image is transparent.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.CanvasCompositeOperation.Lighter
member.summary: Displays the source image + the destination image.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.CanvasCompositeOperation.Copy
member.summary: Displays the source image. The destination image is ignored.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.CanvasCompositeOperation.Xor
member.summary: The source image is combined by using an exclusive OR with the destination image.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerScale
member.summary: Specifies the value of the Scale attribute of the control.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerScale.ShowAll
member.summary: Makes the entire SWF file visible in the specified area without distortion, while maintaining the original aspect ratio of the movie. Borders can appear on two sides of the movie.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerScale.NoScale
member.summary: Prevents the SWF file from scaling to fit the area of the OBJECT or EMBED tag. Cropping can occur.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerScale.NoBorder
member.summary: Scales the SWF file to fill the specified area, while maintaining the original aspect ratio of the file. Flash Player can crop the content, but no distortion occurs.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerScale.ExactFit
member.summary: Makes the entire SWF file visible in the specified area without trying to preserve the original aspect ratio. Distortion can occur.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerQuality
member.summary: Specifies the display list Stage rendering quality of the control.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerQuality.Low
member.summary: Favors playback speed over appearance and never uses anti-aliasing.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerQuality.AutoLow
member.summary: Emphasizes speed at first but improves appearance whenever possible. Playback begins with anti-aliasing turned off. If Flash Player detects that the processor can handle it, anti-aliasing is turned on.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerQuality.AutoHigh
member.summary: Emphasizes playback speed and appearance equally at first but sacrifices appearance for playback speed if necessary. Playback begins with anti-aliasing turned on. If the actual frame rate drops below the specified frame rate, anti-aliasing is turned off to improve playback speed. Use this setting to emulate the View > Antialias setting in Flash Professional.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerQuality.Medium
member.summary: Applies some anti-aliasing and does not smooth bitmaps. It produces a better quality than the Low setting, but lower quality than the High setting.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerQuality.High
member.summary: Favors appearance over playback speed and always applies anti-aliasing. If the movie does not contain animation, bitmaps are smoothed; if the movie has animation, bitmaps are not smoothed.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerQuality.Best
member.summary: Provides the best display quality and does not consider playback speed. All output is anti-aliased and all bitmaps are smoothed.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerScriptAccess
member.summary: Controls the ability to perform outbound URL access from within the SWF file.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerScriptAccess.SameDomain
member.summary: The SWF file communicates with the HTML page it's embedded in only when the SWF file is from the same domain. This value is the default value for AllowScriptAccess. To prevent a SWF file hosted from one domain from accessing a script in an HTML page on another domain, use this setting. Or, don't set a value for AllowScriptAccess,

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerScriptAccess.Always
member.summary: The SWF file can communicate with the HTML page in which it is embedded. This rule applies even when the SWF file is from a different domain than the HTML page.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerScriptAccess.Never
member.summary: The SWF file cannot communicate with any HTML page. Using this value is deprecated and not recommended, and is unnecessary if you don't serve untrusted SWF files from your own domain. If it is necessary to serve untrusted SWF files, Adobe recommends that you create a distinct subdomain and place all untrusted content there.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerWindowMode
member.summary: Controls layering and transparency of the content in the browser. Regardless of the windowMode value, Flash Player displays content viewed in full screen mode using direct path rendering. Using direct path rendering enables hardware accelerated presentation capabilities such as Stage Video and Stage 3D.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerWindowMode.Window
member.summary: The SWF content plays in its own rectangle ("window") on a web page. The browser determines how the SWF content is layered against other HTML elements. With this value, you cannot explicitly specify if SWF content appears above or below other HTML elements on the page.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerWindowMode.Opaque
member.summary: The SWF content is layered together with other HTML elements on the page. The SWF file is opaque and hides everything layered behind it on the page. This option reduces playback performance compared to wmode=window or wmode=direct.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerWindowMode.Transparent
member.summary: The SWF content is layered together with other HTML elements on the page. The SWF file background color (Stage color) is transparent. HTML elements beneath the SWF file are visible through any transparent areas of the SWF, with alpha blending. This option reduces playback performance compared to wmode=window or wmode=direct.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerWindowMode.Direct
member.summary: Use direct to path rendering. This attribute bypasses compositing in the screen buffer and renders the SWF content directly to the screen. This wmode value is recommended to provide the best performance for content playback. It enables hardware accelerated presentation of SWF content that uses Stage Video or Stage 3D.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.FlashPlayerWindowMode.Gpu
member.summary: Use additional hardware acceleration on some Internet-connected TVs and mobile devices. In contrast to other wmode values, pixel fidelity for display list graphics is not guaranteed. Otherwise, this value is similar to wmode=direct.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.ComponentTool
member.summary:
Represent a tool widget that can be displayed inside another control.
A tool widget is different from other child controls: it's displayed inside the parent's layout. For example, the control shows tool widgets inside the caption bar.
When a tool widget is pressed, it fires the toolClicked event on the container.

member.summary: Creates the property manager for the Image properties on first use.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.ComponentTool.Enabled
member.summary: Returns or sets whether the is enabled.
member.returns: true if the widget is enabled; otherwise, false. The default is true or the enabled state inherited from the container .

remarks.para: The tool can be forced enabled or disabled by assigning the property. Use to reset this property to inherit from the container.

If this property is not assigned, the tool will inherit the enabled state from the container . By assigning this property, you can force the tool to be enabled when the container is disabled and vice versa.

member.summary: Resets the property to inherit the enabled state from the container .

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.TreeViewComboBox.VirtualScroll
member.summary: Enables or disables virtual scrolling for the . When virtual scrolling is enabled, only the visible nodes are rendered in the browser allowing the to host virtually unlimited nodes without any performance loss.

remarks.para: When is set to true, all the nodes must be of the same height, limiting the more flexible HTML rendering in the nodes available when is off (default).
Setting the property to a value greater than 0 allows the virtual view to prefetch the specified number of items outside of the visible area to enable smoother scrolling.

member.summary: Fired while the control receives the data being uploaded.

member.summary: Fired before the control received the files being uploaded.

remarks.para: This event fires only if there is an handler attached to it. A simple overload of the On[Event] method in a derived class will not be invoked unless there is at least one handler attached to the event.
You can abort the uploading process by setting e.Cancel = true in the event handler.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.Upload.AllowedFileTypes
member.summary: Specify the types of files that the server accepts (that can be submitted through a file upload).
member.remarks:
The allowed files string follows the HTML 4.01 and HTML5 specifications. You can configure only one entry in the browser's file dialog. The syntax is "file_extension|audio/*|video/*|image/*|media_type" where
file_extension A file extension starting with the dot, e.g: .gif, .jpg, .png, .doc.
audio/* All sound files are accepted
video/* All video files are accepted
image/* All image files are accepted
media_type
A valid media type, with no parameters. Look at IANA Media Types for a complete list of standard media types.
member.returns: The accepted media type separated by a comma. (e.g. "audio/*,video/*,image/*")

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.Upload.CaptureMode

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.Widget.Packages
member.summary: List of packages required to run this widget.

remarks.para: Each package is a URL to either a JavaScript or a CSS file. The packages are loaded in the order they are listed. If a script depends on another script, it should be declared after the script it depends on, i.e.: Query usually if the first script in the package list.
Wisej uses the name of the package to cache it and load it only once. It's important that you use consistent names when creating multiple widgets in order to load the shared packages only once.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.Widget.EnableNativeContextMenu
member.summary: Enables or disables the browser's context menu.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.Widget.InitScript
member.summary: Returns or sets the initialization script.

remarks.para: The initialization script is called after the widget is created and before it is rendered by the browser. It is here that the code should initialize the third party widget, hook up any event, and save any reference it may need.
The initialization function is named "init" and must be declared like this:
The update function is named "update", it is optional, and must be declared like this:
The "options" parameter is optional. It contains a javascript map with all the options defined in the property.
Within the init function you can refer to the Wisej widget class using "this" and to the HTML element using "this.container".
To fire an event back to the server, use "this.fireWidgetEvent() as show in the sample code below:
On the server side, you can handle the and receive any data passed in the "fireWidgetEvent" call in the dynamic object.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.Widget.Options
member.summary: Returns or sets a dynamic object that is passed to the init(options) function upon initialization of the widget and to the update(options, old) when updating the widget.

remarks.note: The class automatically detects changes to first level fields only. If your code changes a nested object you have to either call or notify the object that a property has changed like this:

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.Widget.Instance
member.summary: Returns a that can convert any method call into the equivalent JavaScript call targeting the third party "widget" object.

remarks.para: An application can invoke any method on the wrapped third party widget by using the property. Dynamic method calls are automatically tramformed to JavaScript client calls.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.Widget.WiredEvents
member.summary: Returns or sets the list of events that are fired by the widget wrapper.

remarks.para: Defines the list of events that the widget wrapper can fire. You have to add the code that handles the third party widget's events and fire a server event back to this widget wrapper.
If your initialize code fires the event correctly and the event is registered in the list, the application code can attach a listener to the dynamic object like any native event.

For the sample code above to receive the AreaClick event you have to handle the third party widget event and fire a Wisej event. The syntax for the handler registration depends on each wrapped third party widget: some may use native events, other may use jQuery, and others may use callback methods.
The list of the wired events that the server component expects to receive is available on the client side wrapper using the events array: this.getEvents().

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.ListViewDataStore

Represents the data set returned in response to the IWisejDataStore.OnDataRead request.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.View
member.summary: Specifies how list items are displayed in a control.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.View.LargeIcon
member.summary: Each item appears as a full-sized icon with a label below it.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.View.Details
member.summary: Each item appears on a separate line with further information about each item arranged in columns. The left-most column contains a small icon and label, and subsequent columns contain sub items as specified by the application. A column displays a header which can display a caption for the column. The user can resize each column at run time.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.View.SmallIcon
member.summary: Each item appears as a small icon with a label to its right.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.View.Tile
member.summary: Each item appears as a full-sized icon with the item label and sub item information below the label. Items wrap to a new line from left to right.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.TreeView.VirtualScroll
member.summary: Enables or disables virtual scrolling for the . When virtual scrolling is enabled, only the visible nodes are rendered in the browser allowing the to host virtually unlimited nodes without any performance loss.

remarks.para: When is set to true, all the nodes must be of the same height, limiting the more flexible HTML rendering in the nodes available when is off (default).
Setting the property to a value greater than 0 allows the virtual view to prefetch the specified number of items outside of the visible area to enable smoother scrolling.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole
member.summary: Specifies values representing possible roles for an accessible object.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Default
member.summary: Default role.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.None
member.summary: No role.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.TitleBar
member.summary: A title or caption bar for a window.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.MenuBar
member.summary: A menu bar, usually beneath the title bar of a window, from which users can select menus.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.ScrollBar
member.summary: A vertical or horizontal scroll bar, which can be either part of the client area or used in a control.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Grip
member.summary: A special mouse pointer, which allows a user to manipulate user interface elements such as a window. For example, a user can click and drag a sizing grip in the lower-right corner of a window to resize it.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Sound
member.summary: A system sound, which is associated with various system events.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Cursor
member.summary: A mouse pointer.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Caret
member.summary: A caret, which is a flashing line, block, or bitmap that marks the location of the insertion point in a window's client area.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Alert
member.summary: An alert or condition that you can notify a user about. Use this role only for objects that embody an alert but are not associated with another user interface element, such as a message box, graphic, text, or sound.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Window
member.summary: A window frame, which usually contains child objects such as a title bar, client, and other objects typically contained in a window.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Client
member.summary: A window's user area.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.MenuPopup
member.summary: A menu, which presents a list of options from which the user can make a selection to perform an action. All menu types must have this role, including drop-down menus that are displayed by selection from a menu bar, and shortcut menus that are displayed when the right mouse button is clicked.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.MenuItem
member.summary: A menu item, which is an entry in a menu that a user can choose to carry out a command, select an option, or display another menu. Functionally, a menu item can be equivalent to a push button, radio button, check box, or menu.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.ToolTip
member.summary: A tool tip, which is a small rectangular pop-up window that displays a brief description of the purpose of a button.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Application
member.summary: The main window for an application.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Document
member.summary: A document window, which is always contained within an application window. This role applies only to multiple-document interface (MDI) windows and refers to an object that contains the MDI title bar.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Pane
member.summary: A separate area in a frame, a split document window, or a rectangular area of the status bar that can be used to display information. Users can navigate between panes and within the contents of the current pane, but cannot navigate between items in different panes. Thus, panes represent a level of grouping lower than frame windows or documents, but above individual controls. Typically, the user navigates between panes by pressing TAB, F6, or CTRL+TAB, depending on the context.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Chart
member.summary: A graphical image used to represent data.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Dialog
member.summary: A dialog box or message box.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Border
member.summary: A window border. The entire border is represented by a single object, rather than by separate objects for each side.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Grouping
member.summary: The objects grouped in a logical manner. There can be a parent-child relationship between the grouping object and the objects it contains.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Separator
member.summary: A space divided visually into two regions, such as a separator menu item or a separator dividing split panes within a window.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.ToolBar
member.summary: A toolbar, which is a grouping of controls that provide easy access to frequently used features.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.StatusBar
member.summary: A status bar, which is an area typically at the bottom of an application window that displays information about the current operation, state of the application, or selected object. The status bar can have multiple fields that display different kinds of information, such as an explanation of the currently selected menu command in the status bar.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Table
member.summary: A table containing rows and columns of cells and, optionally, row headers and column headers.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.ColumnHeader
member.summary: A column header, which provides a visual label for a column in a table.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.RowHeader
member.summary: A row header, which provides a visual label for a table row.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Column
member.summary: A column of cells within a table.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Row
member.summary: A row of cells within a table.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Cell
member.summary: A cell within a table.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Link
member.summary: A link, which is a connection between a source document and a destination document. This object might look like text or a graphic, but it acts like a button.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.HelpBalloon
member.summary: A Help display in the form of a ToolTip or Help balloon, which contains buttons and labels that users can click to open custom Help topics.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Character
member.summary: A cartoon-like graphic object, such as Microsoft Office Assistant, which is typically displayed to provide help to users of an application.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.List
member.summary: A list box, which allows the user to select one or more items.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.ListItem
member.summary: An item in a list box or the list portion of a combo box, drop-down list box, or drop-down combo box.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Outline
member.summary: An outline or tree structure, such as a tree view control, which displays a hierarchical list and usually allows the user to expand and collapse branches.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.OutlineItem
member.summary: An item in an outline or tree structure.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.PageTab
member.summary: A property page that allows a user to view the attributes for a page, such as the page's title, whether it is a home page, or whether the page has been modified. Normally, the only child of this control is a grouped object that contains the contents of the associated page.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.PropertyPage
member.summary: A property page, which is a dialog box that controls the appearance and the behavior of an object, such as a file or resource. A property page's appearance differs according to its purpose.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Indicator
member.summary: An indicator, such as a pointer graphic, that points to the current item.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Graphic
member.summary: A picture.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.StaticText
member.summary: The read-only text, such as in a label, for other controls or instructions in a dialog box. Static text cannot be modified or selected.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Text
member.summary: The selectable text that can be editable or read-only.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.PushButton
member.summary: A push button control, which is a small rectangular control that a user can turn on or off. A push button, also known as a command button, has a raised appearance in its default off state and a sunken appearance when it is turned on.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.CheckButton
member.summary: A check box control, which is an option that can be turned on or off independent of other options.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.RadioButton
member.summary: An option button, also known as a radio button. All objects sharing a single parent that have this attribute are assumed to be part of a single mutually exclusive group. You can use grouped objects to divide option buttons into separate groups when necessary.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.ComboBox
member.summary: A combo box, which is an edit control with an associated list box that provides a set of predefined choices.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.DropList
member.summary: A drop-down list box. This control shows one item and allows the user to display and select another from a list of alternative choices.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.ProgressBar
member.summary: A progress bar, which indicates the progress of a lengthy operation by displaying colored lines inside a horizontal rectangle. The length of the lines in relation to the length of the rectangle corresponds to the percentage of the operation that is complete. This control does not take user input.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Dial
member.summary: A dial or knob. This can also be a read-only object, like a speedometer.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.HotkeyField
member.summary: A hot-key field that allows the user to enter a combination or sequence of keystrokes to be used as a hot key, which enables users to perform an action quickly. A hot-key control displays the keystrokes entered by the user and ensures that the user selects a valid key combination.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Slider
member.summary: A control, sometimes called a trackbar, that enables a user to adjust a setting in given increments between minimum and maximum values by moving a slider. The volume controls in the Windows operating system are slider controls.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.SpinButton
member.summary: A spin box, also known as an up-down control, which contains a pair of arrow buttons. A user clicks the arrow buttons with a mouse to increment or decrement a value. A spin button control is most often used with a companion control, called a buddy window, where the current value is displayed.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Diagram
member.summary: A graphical image used to diagram data.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Animation
member.summary: An animation control, which contains content that is changing over time, such as a control that displays a series of bitmap frames, like a filmstrip. Animation controls are usually displayed when files are being copied, or when some other time-consuming task is being performed.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Equation
member.summary: A mathematical equation.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.ButtonDropDown
member.summary: A button that drops down a list of items.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.ButtonMenu
member.summary: A button that drops down a menu.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.ButtonDropDownGrid
member.summary: A button that drops down a grid.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.WhiteSpace
member.summary: A blank space between other objects.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.PageTabList
member.summary: A container of page tab controls.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.Clock
member.summary: A control that displays the time.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.SplitButton
member.summary: A button that has a drop-down list icon directly adjacent to the button.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.IpAddress
member.summary: A control designed for entering Internet Protocol (IP) addresses.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AccessibleRole.OutlineButton
member.summary: A control that navigates like an outline item.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.Appearance
member.summary: Specifies whether a or are displayed using the "button" or "switch" appearance keys or their default appearance.
member.remarks: If the application has set the property , changing the Appearance of a CheckBox or RadioButton has no effect. The AppearanceKey property set by the application has the priority.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Appearance.Normal
member.summary: The default appearance of the control. For default appearance key for the is "checkbox", for the is "radiobutton".

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Appearance.Button
member.summary: The appearance of a button control.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Appearance.Switch
member.summary: The appearance of a toggle switch.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.AutoComplete
member.summary: Specifies the value to assign the autocomplete attribute, used in the control.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AutoComplete.Default
member.summary: Uses the default value configured in the javascript class wisej.web.TextBoxBase. It can be changed in javascript using wisej.web.TextBoxBase.setAutoCompleteDefault("on" | "off").

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AutoComplete.On
member.summary: The browser is allowed to automatically complete the value based on values that the user has entered during previous uses.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AutoComplete.Off
member.summary: The user must explicitly enter a value into this field for every use. The browser does not automatically complete the entry.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.AutoCompleteMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode for the automatic completion feature used in the control.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AutoCompleteMode.None
member.summary: If the drop-down list is already open, scrolls the first item that matches the text into view.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AutoCompleteMode.Suggest
member.summary: Automatically shows the drop-down list as soon as the user starts typing and scrolls the first item that matches the text into view.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AutoCompleteMode.Append
member.summary: Appends the remainder of the most likely candidate string to the existing characters, highlighting the appended text. If the drop-down list is open, scrolls the first item that matches the typed text into view.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AutoCompleteMode.SuggestAppend
member.summary: Automatically shows the drop-down list as soon as the user starts typing and appends the remainder of the most likely candidate string to the existing characters, highlighting the appended text, and scrolls the first item that matches the text into view.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AutoCompleteMode.Filter
member.summary: Automatically shows the drop-down list as soon as the user starts typing, filters the items in the list to show only the ones that begin with the typed text.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AutoCompleteMode.AppendFilter
member.summary: Appends the remainder of the most likely candidate string to the existing characters, highlighting the appended text. If the drop-down list is open, filters the items in the list to show only the ones that begin with the typed text.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.AutoScaleMode
member.summary: Specifies the supported types of automatic scaling modes.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AutoScaleMode.None
member.summary: Automatic scaling is disabled.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AutoScaleMode.Font
member.summary: Controls scale relative to the dimensions of the font.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AutoScaleMode.Inherit
member.summary: Controls scale according to the parent's scaling mode. If there is no parent, automatic scaling is disabled.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.AutoSizeMode
member.summary: Specifies how a control will behave when its property is enabled.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AutoSizeMode.GrowAndShrink
member.summary: The control grows or shrinks to fit its contents. The control cannot be resized manually.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AutoSizeMode.GrowOnly
member.summary: The control grows as much as necessary to fit its contents but does not shrink smaller than the value of its property. The control can be resized, but cannot be made so small that any of its contained controls are hidden.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.AutoValidate
member.summary: Determines how a control validates its data when it loses user input focus.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AutoValidate.Inherit
member.summary: The control inherits its behavior from its container (such as a form or another control). If there is no container control, it defaults to .

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AutoValidate.Disable
member.summary: Implicit validation will not occur. Setting this value will not interfere with explicit calls to or .

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AutoValidate.EnablePreventFocusChange
member.summary: Implicit validation occurs when the control loses focus.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.AutoValidate.EnableAllowFocusChange
member.summary: Implicit validation occurs, but if validation fails, focus will still change to the new control. If validation fails, the event will not fire.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.BorderStyle
member.summary: Specifies the border style for a control.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.BorderStyle.None
member.summary: No border.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.BorderStyle.Solid
member.summary: A solid line border.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.BorderStyle.Dotted
member.summary: A dotted line border.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.BorderStyle.Dashed
member.summary: A dashed line border.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.BorderStyle.Double

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.MdiLayout
member.summary: Specifies the layout of multiple document interface (MDI) child windows in an MDI parent window.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.MdiLayout.Cascade
member.summary: All MDI child windows are cascaded within the client region of the MDI parent form.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.MdiLayout.TileHorizontal
member.summary: All MDI child windows are tiled horizontally within the client region of the MDI parent form.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.MdiLayout.TileVertical
member.summary: All MDI child windows are tiled vertically within the client region of the MDI parent form.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.MdiLayout.ArrangeIcons
member.summary: All MDI child icons are arranged within the client region of the MDI parent form.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.MenuMerge.MergeItems

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.MenuMerge.Remove

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.PanelAutoShowMode
member.summary: Specifies how a collapsed automatically shows its content.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.PanelAutoShowMode.Never
member.summary: The content is never shown unless the panel is expanded.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.PanelAutoShowMode.OnClick
member.summary: The content is shown when the collapsed header is clicked.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.PictureBoxSizeMode
member.summary: Specifies how an image is positioned within a .

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.PictureBoxSizeMode.Normal
member.summary: The image is placed in the upper-left corner of the . The image is clipped if it is larger than the it is contained in.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.PictureBoxSizeMode.StretchImage
member.summary: The image within the is stretched or shrunk to fit the size of the .

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.PictureBoxSizeMode.AutoSize
member.summary: The is sized equal to the size of the image that it contains.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.PictureBoxSizeMode.CenterImage
member.summary: The image is displayed in the center if the is larger than the image. If the image is larger than the , the picture is placed in the center of the and the outside edges are clipped.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.PictureBoxSizeMode.Zoom
member.summary: The size of the image is increased or decreased maintaining the size ratio.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.PictureBoxSizeMode.Cover
member.summary: The image is resized to cover the entire container, even if it has to stretch the image or cut a little bit off one of the edges.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.Placement
member.summary: Determines the position of the popup in relation to the opener control.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Placement.TopLeft
member.summary: The popup is shown above the opener aligned to the left edge.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Placement.TopCenter
member.summary: The popup is shown above the opener and horizontally centered.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Placement.TopRight
member.summary: The popup is shown above the opener aligned to the right edge.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Placement.BottomLeft
member.summary: The popup is shown below the opener aligned to the left edge.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Placement.BottomCenter
member.summary: The popup is shown below the opener and horizontally centered.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Placement.BottomRight
member.summary: The popup is shown below the opener aligned to the right edge.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Placement.LeftTop
member.summary: The popup is shown to the left of the opener aligned to the top edge.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Placement.LeftMiddle
member.summary: The popup is shown to the left of the opener and vertically centered.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Placement.LeftBottom
member.summary: The popup is shown to the left of the opener aligned to the bottom edge.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Placement.RightTop
member.summary: The popup is shown to the right of the opener aligned to the top edge.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Placement.RightMiddle
member.summary: The popup is shown to the right of the opener and vertically centered.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Placement.RightBottom
member.summary: The popup is shown to the right of the opener aligned to the bottom edge.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.PlacementMode
member.summary: Determines the algorithm to use to calculate the position of the popup.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.PlacementMode.Direct
member.summary: Places the popup using the specified alignment without changes.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.PlacementMode.KeepAlign
member.summary: If parts of the popup are outside of the visible range, the popup is placed at the best alignment position.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.PlacementMode.BestFit
member.summary: Places the popup according to the specified alignment adjusting the location when the parts of popup are out of the visible range.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.Position
member.summary: Specifies one of four positions in a container.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Position.Top
member.summary: Indicates the top side of a container.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Position.Right
member.summary: Indicates the right side of a container.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Position.Bottom
member.summary: Indicates the bottom side of a container.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.Position.Left
member.summary: Indicates the left side of a container.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.ProgressBarStyle
member.summary: Specifies the style that a uses to indicate the progress of an operation.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.ProgressBarStyle.Blocks
member.summary: Indicates progress by increasing the number of segmented blocks in a .

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.ProgressBarStyle.Continuous
member.summary: Indicates progress by increasing the size of a smooth, continuous bar in a .

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.ProgressBarStyle.Marquee
member.summary: Indicates progress by continuously scrolling a block across a in a marquee fashion.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.RightToLeft
member.summary: Specifies a value indicating whether the control's elements are aligned right-to-left to support right-to-left languages.
member.remarks: Use to determine whether the current culture uses a right-to-left language.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.RightToLeft.No
member.summary: The control is aligned from left to right. This is the default.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.RightToLeft.Yes
member.summary: The control is aligned from right to left.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.RightToLeft.Inherit
member.summary: The value is inherited from the parent control. If the control is a top level container, the value is set automatically according to the current culture and the "rightToLeft" setting in Default.json.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.ScrollBars
member.summary: Specifies which scroll bars will be visible on a control.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.ScrollBars.None
member.summary: No scroll bars are shown and scrolling functionality is disabled.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.ScrollBars.Horizontal
member.summary: Shows only the horizontal scroll bar when necessary.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.ScrollBars.Vertical
member.summary: Shows only the vertical scroll bar when necessary.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.ScrollBars.Both
member.summary: Both scroll bars are shown when necessary.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.ScrollBars.Hidden
member.summary: Scrolling functionality is active but the scrollbar are hidden.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.ScrollEventType
member.summary: Specifies the type of action used to raise the event.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.ScrollEventType.Decrement
member.summary: The scroll box was moved a small distance. The user clicked the left(horizontal) or top(vertical) scroll arrow.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.ScrollEventType.Increment
member.summary: The scroll box was moved a small distance. The user clicked the right(horizontal) or bottom(vertical) scroll arrow.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.ScrollEventType.First
member.summary: The scroll box was moved to the position.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.ScrollEventType.Last
member.summary: The scroll box was moved to the position.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.ScrollOrientation
member.summary: Specifies the scroll bar orientation for the event.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.ScrollOrientation.HorizontalScroll
member.summary: The horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.ScrollOrientation.VerticalScroll
member.summary: The vertical scroll bar.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.SelectionMode
member.summary: Specifies the selection behavior of a , a or a .

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.SelectionMode.None
member.summary: No items can be selected.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.SelectionMode.One
member.summary: Only one item can be selected.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.SelectionMode.MultiSimple
member.summary: Multiple items can be selected.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.SelectionMode.MultiExtended
member.summary: Multiple items can be selected, and the user can use the SHIFT, CTRL, and arrow keys to make selections.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.SizeType
member.summary: Specifies how an element a UI element should be sized relative to the parent container.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.SizeType.AutoSize
member.summary: The element should be automatically sized to share space with its peers.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.SizeType.Absolute
member.summary: The element should be sized to an exact number of pixels.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.SizeType.Percent
member.summary: The element should be sized as a percentage of the parent container.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.SortOrder
member.summary: Specifies how items in a list are sorted.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.SortOrder.None
member.summary: The items are not sorted.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.SortOrder.Ascending
member.summary: The items are sorted in ascending order.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.SortOrder.Descending
member.summary: The items are sorted in descending order.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.StatusBarPanelAutoSize
member.summary: Specifies how a on a control behaves when the control resizes.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.StatusBarPanelAutoSize.None
member.summary: The does not change size when the control resizes.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.StatusBarPanelAutoSize.Spring
member.summary: The uses the available space on the (the space not taken up by other panels whose property is set to or ) and shares it with other panels that have their property set to .

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.StatusBarPanelAutoSize.Contents
member.summary: The width of the is determined by its contents.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.StatusBarPanelBorderStyle

member.summary: No border.

member.summary: A solid line border.

member.summary: A dotted line border.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.StatusBarPanelBorderStyle.Dashed
member.summary: A dashed line border.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.StatusBarPanelBorderStyle.Double
member.summary: A double solid line border.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.StatusBarPanelBorderStyle.Raised
member.summary: A three-dimensional raised border.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.StatusBarPanelBorderStyle.Sunken
member.summary: A three-dimensional sunken border.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.TextBoxType
member.summary: Specifies the type of <input> element to display.

member.name: F:Wisej.Web.TextBoxType.Text
member.summary: Default. Defines a single-line text field (default width is 20 characters).

summary.para: Wisej.Web contains all the controls that are part of the Wisej Web Framework.
summary.note: The only nested namespace is Wisej.Web.Ext, used to define all the Wisej Web extensions that are designed specifically for the web components.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.Formatter
member.summary: Generic formatter helper class.

member.name: M:Wisej.Web.Formatter.FormatObject(System.Object,System.Type,System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter,System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Converts a binary value into a format suitable for display to the end user. Used when pushing a value from a back-end data source into a data-bound property on a control.

member.name: M:Wisej.Web.Formatter.FormatObjectInternal(System.Object,System.Type,System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter,System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.Object)
member.summary:
Converts a value into a format suitable for display to the end user.
- Converts DBNull or null into a suitable formatted representation of 'null' - Performs some special-case conversions (eg. Boolean to CheckState) - Uses TypeConverters or IConvertible where appropriate - Throws a FormatException is no suitable conversion can be found

member.summary: Converts a value entered by the end user (through UI) into the corresponding binary value. Used when pulling input from a data-bound property on a control to store in a back-end data source.

member.summary: Converts a value entered by the end user (through UI) into the corresponding binary value. Used when pulling input from a data-bound property on a control to store in a back-end data source.

member.summary:
Converts a value entered by the end user (through UI) into the corresponding binary value.
- Converts formatted representations of 'null' into DBNull - Performs some special-case conversions (eg. CheckState to Boolean) - Uses TypeConverters or IConvertible where appropriate - Throws a FormatException is no suitable conversion can be found

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.PropertyStore
member.summary:
Lightweight collection of variable properties.
This store is used by data items (like cells in a datagrid or items in a listview) that need to store only the properties that have a value in order to save memory for large collections.
Values are stored in a simple array of entries where each value is associated to an integer key.

member.name: T:Wisej.Web.Application
member.summary: Represent a Wisej application session. Provides methods and events to manage the application in the context of the current session.

remarks.para:
This class provides several static methods, properties and events that allow the application to manage all sorts of features related to the current session:
Save and retrieve session variable. Use to store and retrieve session variable. The property is a dynamic object and a , therefore you can access its properties directly or through the indexer.
Application.Session.myValue = 12; Application.Session["myValue"] = 12;
Manage cookies. Use to manage browser's cookies.
Read server variables. Use to retrieve all the data made available by the server. Some of the variables in the collection are also available directly: , , , etc.
Read the application's URL. Use , , , and .
Read the applications's system information. Use , , , etc.
Listen to the application's global events.
See , , , , , , and many more.
Retrieve browser related information. Use the to read the client browser type, OS, version, capabilities, screen size, browser size, language, and state. The object is updated automatically when the user resizes the browser or the page is reloaded.
Control the client browser.
Start a , execute JavaScript functions or scriptlets using or . Make the browser navigate to a different URL using or simply the page.
Manage the main page or current desktop.
lets you change the object that fills the browser and "navigate" from page to page. lets you change the active object on the client browser.
Manage all live components in the session.
Through the class you can find, iterate, inspect all live components of any type. See for all the currently created (visible or invisible) instances of . returns all the created objects.
and provide an easy way to find any component in the session or to iterate the list of components that match a custom expression.
Start background tasks in context. provides a powerful way to start a background task on the server that can keep interacting with the client browser while running independently.
Manage the application's theme. Use to load a Wisej theme into the application. Or use the object to read all sorts of information from the current .
Terminate the application without waiting for the session to timeout. Use to terminate the current session and free all the related memory.
There is a lot more exposed by the class. You can inspect all the properties and methods in Visual Studio through IntelliSense or online at .

member.name: E:Wisej.Web.Application.ThreadBegin
member.summary: Fired when the current thread starts processing the request from the client.
member.remarks:
This event is not related to a session. Any static code can attach to this event in order to setup or clean up thread static fields or any other isolated static storage.
It is best to attach to this event from a static type initializer.

member.name: E:Wisej.Web.Application.ThreadEnd
member.summary: Fired when the current thread has completed processing the request from the client.
member.remarks:
This event is not related to a session. Any static code can attach to this event in order to setup or clean up thread static fields or any other isolated static storage.
It is best to attach to this event from a static type initializer.

member.name: P:Wisej.Web.Application.Current
member.summary: Returns the application component instance that an application can store and use later to restore the context when updating client widgets during an out-of-bound call using

remarks.para: Threads that are not started using don't have any knowledge of the current session and don't have a way to communicate with the client
The property returns the instance of the class that is bound to the current session. It can be used just like any other component with or to restore the session for the current thread.
The advantage of using instead of the instance of a control or a page is to avoid to keep a reference to a component that may be disposed by the application.

member.name: M:Wisej.Web.Application.StartPolling(System.Int32)
member.summary: Instructs the client to start polling the server for UI changes at the specified when a WebSocket connection is not available.
member.param: Polling interval in milliseconds. The minimum is 1000ms.

remarks.para: Calling this method when is true has no effect.

Use client side polling when you know that your code will start a background task that needs to update the client asynchronously (push updates) and your server or clients don't support WebSocket connections.
Once the background tasks are completed call to reduce the incoming requests from the client.

member.exception: The specified is less than 1.

member.name: M:Wisej.Web.Application.StartTask(System.Action)
member.summary: Starts a new task within the current application context and returns immediately. See also .
member.param: Start method invoked by the new task when it starts up.

remarks.para: The task runs in the background but it's still capable of updating the client asynchronously when working with WebSocket by calling the method to push the UI updates to the client browser.

If you want to support background updates for clients or servers that can't use the WebSocket connection, you can either add a component to the parent container to force period requests to the server, or you can use the and methods.

member.returns: An awaitable .

member.name: M:Wisej.Web.Application.StartTask``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Starts a new task with a return value within the current application context and returns immediately. See also .
member.param: Start method invoked by the new task when it starts up.

remarks.para: The task runs in the background but it's still capable of updating the client asynchronously when working with WebSocket by calling the method to push the UI updates to the client browser.
The generics overload of allows the task to return a value. You can use this with the async/await pattern and asynchronously wait for the task to complete.

If you want to support background updates for clients or servers that can't use the WebSocket connection, you can either add a component to the parent container to force period requests to the server, or you can use the and methods.
Note that you don't have to specify the type in the angular brackets, the compiler will automatically detect the type from the return value of the asynchronous function.

The time interval between invocations, in milliseconds.
A callback method to invoke at the specified intervals.
member.returns: An instance of .

remarks.para: You must save a reference to the returned or the Garbage Collector will stop and dispose the timer.
To alter the invocation period user Timer.Changer(), or stop the timer simply use Timer.Dispose(). See .

Function to execute in context. The code in the function can access all the static Application properties when executed from an out-of-bound thread.

member.name: M:Wisej.Web.Application.Update(Wisej.Core.IWisejComponent,System.Action)
member.summary: Executes the optional callback in context and pushes all the pending updates to the client when in WebSocket mode.
member.param: The application context to update. It can be any Wisej component or the returned by the property .
Function to execute in context. The code in the function can access all the static Application properties when executed from an out-of-bound thread.

remarks.para: Use this method when you need to update the client asynchronously from an out-of-bound thread (different thread, not originating from a client request).
You can call this method at the end of the code that updates the UI:
Or you can use the optional function to enclose the code that updates the UI in a block and ensure that the client is updated when the code block exits:

member.summary: Displays a message in a dialog box, waits for the user to click a button, and then returns an integer indicating which button the user clicked.
member.returns: One of .
member.param: Context object that initiated this call.
Required. String expression displayed as the message in the dialog box.

Optional. Numeric expression that is the sum of values specifying the number and type of buttons to display, the icon style to use, the identity of the default button, and the modality of the message box. If you omit , the default value is zero.
Optional. String expression displayed in the title bar of the dialog box. If you omit , the application name is placed in the title bar.
Optional. Asynchronous callback.

Required. String expression displayed as the message in the dialog box.

Optional. Numeric expression that is the sum of values specifying the number and type of buttons to display, the icon style to use, the identity of the default button, and the modality of the message box. If you omit , the default value is zero.
Optional. String expression displayed in the title bar of the dialog box. If you omit , the application name is placed in the title bar.

member.name: M:Wisej.Web.VisualBasic.Interaction.InputBox(System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Action{System.String})
member.summary: Displays a prompt in a dialog box, waits for the user to input text or click a button, and then returns a string containing the contents of the text box.
member.returns: The contents of the text box.
member.param: Context object that initiated this call.
Required String expression displayed as the message in the dialog box.
Optional. String expression displayed in the title bar of the dialog box. If you omit , the application name is placed in the title bar.
Optional. String expression displayed in the text box as the default response if no other input is provided. If you omit , the displayed text box is empty.
Optional. Numeric expression that specifies, in pixels, the distance of the left edge of the dialog box from the left edge of the screen. If you omit , the dialog box is centered horizontally.
Optional. Numeric expression that specifies, in pixels, the distance of the upper edge of the dialog box from the top of the screen. If you omit , the dialog box is centered vertically.
Optional. Asynchronous callback.

member.returns: An instance of containing all the values parsed from the stream.
